'''Brenda Tess Broussard''' is an [[United States|American]], an [[actress]], a [[model (person)|glamour model]] and a [[media personality]] born in 1968.
[[Image:Tess Broussard 2010.jpg|thumb|alt=Tess Broussard in Los Angeles 2010.|Tess Broussard in Los Angeles, 2010.]]
==Early life== Broussard grew up in [[Dallas, Texas]]. Her first television appearance was on [[Romper Room]] at age 5. Broussard studied tap, ballet, and jazz during her teen years and varsity lettered in basketball, track and tennis in high school.
She attended [[Randolph-Macon Woman's College|Randolph Macon Woman's College]], an all-girls liberal arts school in Lynchburg, Virginia, then transferred to [[Pepperdine University]] where in 1988 she graduated with a Bachelor of Arts. In 1990, Broussard received a paralegal certificate from the [[University of West Los Angeles]].
==Career== While attending Pepperdine University, Broussard was acting and modeling. She booked her first national commercial - a [[General Motors|GMC truck]] commercial during her junior year. She also worked as a spokesmodel for [[E3 (Electronic Entertainment Expo)]] video game conventions in Los Angeles for the company [[THQ]] from 1997â2003 and as a [[Cadillac]] spokesmodel from 2001-2003. Broussard appeared in the 1997 British edition of [[FHM]], Risque - Shirley's of Hollywood Lingerie Catalog 1996,<ref>Shirley's of Hollywood http://www.shirleyofhollywood.com</ref> and the 1998 [[Harley-Davidson]] Calendar.
Broussard went on to host and act in [[Playboy]] TV and video shows such as [[Playboy Videos|Playboy's Hollywood Stripsearch 3, 2001]] and [[Playboy Videos|Playboy Girls of the Grotto 2000]]. Broussard also appeared in their magazine as a Playboy model. Broussard appeared in many [[MTV]] hip hop music videos such as a dancer in Will Smith's Get Jiggy Wit It (1997),<ref>Will Smith's Getting Jiggy Wit It http://www.mtv.com/videos/will-smith/10018/gettin-jiggy-wit-it.jhtml</ref> lead girl in South Park's [[Kenny's dead|Kenny's Dead]] tonight with Master P (1999), and girl wrestler in Warren G and Ron Isley's Smokin Me Out (1997).<ref>Warren G and The Isley Brothers Smok'n Me Out http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xrrGi_VGvzc</ref>
Broussard's first big break in television was being cast in [[Saban Entertainment|Saban Entertainment's]] action children show [[VR Troopers]] as the Pink Vixen. Besides starring in the action genre, Broussard also co-starred in comedy television shows like The Jamie Foxx Show: Hot Coco on a Cold night (2000),<ref>The Jaime Foxx Show http://www.imdb.com/title/tt0115221/</ref> and has made hosting appearances on the [[Game Show Network|Extreme Gong Show (1999)]]. Another action film Broussard appeared in was Supreme Champion (2010)<ref>Supreme Champion (2010) http://www.imdb.com/title/tt1283546/</ref> and she co-starred in the action/comedy movie Secret Agent 420 (2005).<ref>Agent 420 (2005) http://www.imdb.com/title/tt0244944/</ref> She has starred in several [[HBO]] and [[Cinemax]] movies such as Andromina: The Pleasure Planet (1999),<ref>Andromina: The Pleasure Planet (1999) http://www.imdb.com/title/tt0222719/</ref> Survivors Exposed (2001),<ref>Survivors Exposed (2001) http://www.imdb.com/title/tt0290082/</ref> and Emmanuelle 2000: Emmanuelle in Paradise (2000).<ref>Emmanuelle 2000: Emmanuelle in Paradise 2000 http://www.imdb.com/title/tt0295231/</ref>
==Personal life==
Broussard was engaged to wrestling star Stone Cold Steve Austin<ref>Steve Austin (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Steve_Austin_wrestler)</ref> from 2002 to 2004.
